intro: Cistanthera papaverifera, commonly known as the pink-flowered cistanthera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a woody stem with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It is adapted to sandy soils and is often found in heathland environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and sometimes threatened species.
